conclusion: Analyze the process on the pressure-volume (P-V) diagram to determine work done.
Process A→B is isobaric with constant pressure at 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Volume at state A is 3 L and at state B is 4 L.
Change in volume, ΔV, is 1 L.
Work done by gas during isobaric process is W = P ΔV.
Calculate work done: W = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (0.001 m^3) = 100 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state A to state B is 100 Joules.
